episode_title: 507 - The One Where Ross Moves In
note: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are there. Joey is looking at a National Geographic and giggling.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you looking at naked tribe’s women?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, look. (Shows him the magazine.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a pig.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, I know, but look at the knobs on her.
(Ross enters and his hair is a mess.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! (Joey quickly hides the magazine under the couch.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Emily’s cousin kicked me out!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, when you’re subletting an apartment from your wife’s cousin and then you get a divorce, sometimes the cousin suddenly wants his apartment back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How can he do that? Didn’t you sign a lease?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who needs a lease when it’s family !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you can stay with us! We’ll take care of ya!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah! Absolutely! Anything you need man! But you have to promise me the second you are feeling better so that we can make fun of your hair!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You got it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks you guys, I really appreciate this. All right, I’m gonna get packing again. Man, I’ve been moving around so much I’m beginning to feel like a nomad.
(Joey starts giggling.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He thought you said gonad.
(Joey busts out laughing.)

content.description: Monica’s restaurant, she is getting inspected by the health department, Phoebe is watching.

content.speaker: Health Inspector
content.text: Wow, Monica, if every restaurant is as clean as yours, I’d have a tough time making a living.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, Larry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, do health inspectors work on commission?

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: No, bribes.
(Phoebe laughs.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s okay to laugh right?

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: Yeah, I was just kidding.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (She laughs harder.)

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: I’ll check the kitchen floors.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, knock yourself out, Larry.
(He goes into the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yum-my!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Larry?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah! I’d let him check out my kitchen floors.

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: A 98. I deducted 2 points because you are not wearing your chef’s hat, and that is a Section 5 violation.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, look, Larry honey, umm, I wrote the book on Section 5 and I know that you don’t have to wear your hat unless you’re in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: And where is your hat?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s in the kitchen, I’ll go get it.
(She heads for the kitchen door and just after she goes through the door…)

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: Ahh that’s the 2 points.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, you should really read that book you wrote. (To Larry) Wow! You saw the hat in the kitchen and knew that she’d have to go in there hatless to get it. You can have your own health inspector detective show!

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: Oh, I don’t know about that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but then I can be you sidekick Vunda.

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: Maybe uh, Vunda could give me her number and I can ask her to dinner sometime.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, she would love that! Y’know, ’cause you know all the clean places to eat.

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: I-I’ll call ya.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.
(Larry goes to leave but heads the wrong way and makes a quick sidestep to go out the right door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He’s so funny! (She imitates what he just did.)

content.description: Central Perk, Gunther is serving Monica and Rachel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. (To Monica) Mon?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hmm?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How’s Ross doing? Y’know since all the Emily stuff.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s not great umm, but he’s dealing with it. Oh wait a minute, you’re not gonna try…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, honey, please, no, I can’t get started with all that Ross stuff again. I mean, he’s gonna screwed up for a looong time. And besides y’know, I don’t, I don’t go for guys right after they get divorced.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Right, you only go for them 5 minutes before they get married.
(Danny enters.)

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Two pounds of Moca Java please.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Danny. Are you guys ever gonna go out again?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know! He hasn’t called me since that one time when we went out. I see him in the hallway, we flirt, I’m all ha-ha-ha-ha, and nothing.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi Danny! (Notices his box of liquor he’s carrying.) Wow! Thirsty huh?

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Uh, actually, actually, I’m having a party at my place on Saturday, it’s sort of a house warming kind of thing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, fun!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, great!

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Yeah, I’m really looking forward to it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Okay, see ya. (Heads out.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I guess we won’t be warming his house.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. All right, I see what he’s doing! He’s not asking me out, because he wants me to ask him out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And you’re not gonna do that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s right! ’Cause that would give him the control! So now he’s all ooh, coming up with this whole I’ve got a party thing y’know, trying to get me to hint around for an invitation. Blew up in his face, didn’t it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So-so there is no party.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, there’s a party. There’s a party. But the power, that is still up for grabs. You follow me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think so. Se, he-he’s not inviting you to his party because he likes you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Exactly.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, they’re entering to find boxes strewn about the apartment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey roomies!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Love what you’ve done with the place.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, yeah I know, I know, it’s a lot of boxes, but again I really appreciate you guys letting me stay here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not a problem. And listen, hey! Since you’re gonna be here for a while, why don’t—I was thinking we uh, put your name on the answering machine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I uh, hope you don’t mind, I kinda uh, jazzed it up a little. Check this out. (He plays the greeting, and We Will Rock You starts to play and Ross’s voice comes over it.) We will, we will, call you back!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, all right!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pretty cool, huh?
(They both laugh as Ross heads back to the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re fake laughing too, right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, the tears are real.

content.description: A restaurant, Phoebe and Larry are having dinner.

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: You look beautiful this evening.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Show me the badge again.
(He looks around and flashes her his badge and she laughs.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shiny.

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: Oh, will you mind if I wash up? Because I came straight from work and who knows where these babies (Holds up his hands) have been.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You are just nonstop!
(He goes to the bathroom and Phoebe puts some pepper and salt on her food. With the salt she takes a bit and throws it over her left shoulder as she faces us.)

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: We’re outta here!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: Just walking past the kitchen I saw 10 violations! I’m shutting this place down!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You have the power to do that?

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: This does. (Shows her his badge.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shut it down.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is entering. As he closes the door, Joey pokes his head up from a box enclosure built using the 2 chairs.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You built a fort didn’t ya?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Kinda.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God, the air purifier! Ross’s air purifier! All I heard through 4 years of college was (makes a humming noise.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, you should’ve gone out once and a while.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I hate this thing!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on, Chandler, Ross is our friend. He needs us right now, so why don’t you be a grown up and come and watch some TV in the fort!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is opening the door.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi Danny.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Hey guys, I just uh, wanted to invite you to the party tomorrow night.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, thanks! We’ll try to stop by.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, actually, I think I’m gonna be busy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You are?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Remember I got that uh, gala.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Yeah, what’s the gala for?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s a uh, regatta gala.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Really! You-you sail?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no, but I support it.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Okay, (To Monica) hope I see you tomorrow night.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Take care. (Leaves.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Closes the door.) Walked right into that one didn’t he?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What one? You wanted him to invite you to the party and he did it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but he waited until the last minute! So if I said yes, he would know I had nothing better to do than wait around for an invitation to his stupid party. I said, “No!” Which puts me right back in the driver seat.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great. So the ball is in his court?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ball? There is no ball.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s and Ross’s, Ross is working on his computer and Joey is making a lot of noise.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, please! (Motions to his computer.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sorry.
(Joey starts playing with a toy alligator and has it attack him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahhhhhhhhhh…

(Notices Ross looking at him and stops. Ross gives him his ‘quiet down’ maneuver. Okay, this may take a while to explain, so center this on you screen and place your hands about a foot apart with your fingers together and pointing straight up. Now take you fingers and point them at the other hand and making a 90-degree angle with each of your hands and the first knuckle counting up from the wrist. Now take your right hand, no your other right (that was for the dyslexics), and lower it a couple of inches, so that the fingers are pointing at your wrist. Now take your arms and keeping the elbows bent and your hands in front of you spread out your arms, kinda like making a bird’s wing. Now hunch your shoulders over and move you hands up and down as if you are trying to tell some one to turn it down. That’s Ross ‘quiet down’ maneuver. Well, there is an accompanying face, but I don’t want to try and describe it as well.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello children!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Wanna play some foosball? Please?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Starts to head for where the foosball table usually is.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, no! We have to move the table into my room, yeah! ’Cause of all the boxes. Come on!
(They go into his bedroom.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I have one question. What is the deal with this? (Imitates Ross’s ‘quiet down’ maneuver, but does move his hands up and down he just flaps his hands as if he’s waving good-bye.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye-bye little puppet Joey hand?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, the quiet down thing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean this. (Does the maneuver perfectly.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Um-hmm! Look, I-I-I don’t know how much more of this I can take! Did you know he taped over my Baywatch tape with some show about bugs! My God! What if that had been porn?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right look, y’know, this maybe tough but come on, this is Ross! I survived college with him!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I guess I can hold out a little longer. Let’s have a game.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(They start playing.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: YES!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh fellas, (Does the maneuver and gives them a double thumbs up, which Chandler returns as he closes the door.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so he’s out of here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You guys got anything to eat? I just went down to Johnos for some chicken and it was closed!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I took Larry there to eat but it was all violated. So we shut it down!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs, if this guy keeps closing down all of our favorite places, where are we gonna eat?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know, clean places?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm, yum!
(There’s a knock on the door and Monica answers it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s Danny.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Don’t let him in! I’m supposed to be at a regatta gala.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’ll be right there! (To Rachel) Can’t you just say it starts later?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? What kind of a regatta gala starts at night?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The fake kind!
(She opens the door and Rachel hides behind it.)

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Hey, hi, I need a ladle. You got a ladle?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We have a ladle. (Gives him one.)

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Thanks, see you at the party.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, great!
(He leaves and she closes the door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, guys, you know what Larry would say? He would say, “See you ladle.” (Laughs.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, and Ross are there. Chandler and Joey are looking through the paper.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I-I-I’m done with this. You want anything Ross? Sports? International? Apartment listings?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ll take sports.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mine! (He grabs it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. Uhh, international.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh that’s mine too! (Grabs it and Ross looks at him.) I’m Italian!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I guess I can check out those apartment listings, even though there’s never anything in here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not even on page 7?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah! You’re—hey, you’re right! Here’s an affordable place, (reading ad) two bedroom, close to work, ooh, it’s available in five weeks!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What about that circled one?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I-I don’t know, it’s kind of expensive for a studio.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But it’s available now! Isn’t it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, it is.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, let’s go look at it! (They both jump up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, let’s go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There we go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh-ooh, hey guys, I was wondering if you guys would uh, maybe chip in on some new air filters for the air purifier? I mean after all, we all are using it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let’s go quicker.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.description: The apartment in the listing, the guys are checking it out. There’s one problem though, it’s roughly the size of this computer screen. As they enter Joey lets out a whistle.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God! (Looking around, which doesn’t take him long.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well look at this kitchen, slash bathroom. Well that’s great! Y’know so you can cook while in the tub.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Somebody was using his head. Hey, let’s check out the rest of the place.
(They don’t move, just look all around them.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think this is it. I don’t know, maybe we should keep looking.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But hey, Ross, this place is available now!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, you don’t want to be stuck with us for the next five weeks.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.
(He looks at them.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, you-you think I should go ahead and take this place?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it’s perfect!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How about you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a kitchen slash bathroom.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, I see what you guys are saying. I’ll uh, I’ll go downstairs and fill out an application.
(He exits.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We are bad people.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He knew we were trying to get rid of him. He knew! (Pause.) You think we could get a bathtub in our kitchen?

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is there waiting for Larry.

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: Hey, ready for dinner?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, absolutely!

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: Great! How about you wanted to go the Italian place down on Bleaker Street right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, I love that place! (Thinks about it.) So, no.

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: How about Mama Lisettie’s?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Enh. Sure!

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: I wonder how long that milk (on the counter) has been setting out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, no-no, this place is totally healthy! That—this milk is mine. I bought this today, ’cause I was thirsty for milk, y’know. (She takes a swig of it, but has to turn away from him as she makes a face to show that it has gone bad.) Okay, let’s go!
(Just as they’re about to leave, Gunther comes out of the back carrying two garbage bags. Larry sees this and stops him.)

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: Hey, buddy! (Flashes his badge.) Are you familiar with Section 11-B of the Health Code that requires all refuse material out the back exit?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: But then I’d have to go all the way around the dry cleaner place.

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: Oh, so you’re saying you’d choose convenience over health?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, stop! Larry, okay, can’t you just be Larry and not Larry the health inspector guy? Y’know I mean it was really exciting at first but now it’s like, okay, so where are we gonna eat ever?

content.speaker: Larry
content.text: Well, I suppose I could give him a warning.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you. (To Gunther, who’s standing there frozen) Okay, go! Go! Go! (He runs off.) (To Larry) Now, if after dinner you still really need to bust someone, I know a hot dog vendor who picks his nose.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler and Joey are lamenting about how they kicked Ross out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe, maybe we did a good thing, helping Ross get back on his feet!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes that was a nice place!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not a lot of closet space, but he can just hang his stuff out the window in a bag!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are we gonna do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. Maybe pizza?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: About Ross!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! Oh!
(The phone rings and Joey answers it.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello! (Listens.) Oh yeah! (To Chandler) It’s the apartment manager; Ross put us down as references. (To the apartment manager.) Ross is the greatest guy you’ll ever meet! Yeah, he’s very reliable.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Of course he has this big huge dog! That uh, barks into the night. (Listens.) Well, who doesn’t love dogs? (Thinks.) Ah, he’s a tap dancer! (Listens.) Yes, some would say that is a lost art. (Thinks.) He’s a pimp! (Listens.) There you go! Yes, he’s a pimp. He’s a big, tap dancing pimp! (Pause.) Hello?

(The apartment manager hung up on him and he hangs up the phone and throws in on the chair. Joey motions, “What the hell was that?” Chandler makes a face to say, “Think about it.” Joey tries to divide 136 by 13; he’s confused. Suddenly, light dawns on yonder dunder head. He gets it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohhhhh!
(Joey motions, “Now, that’s thinking!”)

content.description: Downstairs at Danny’s party, Monica and Rachel are coming down the stairs and Rachel has on a coat to make it look as if she’s just getting back. But just as they reach the landing they see Danny out in the hall talking to a guest, Rachel then quickly pulls Monica back up the stairs.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Shoot, shoot, this is never gonna work! He’s right there!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Just go over and say hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I have to go downstairs and come back up as if I’m coming home from the regatta gala. Okay? So just go distract him. But don’t be sexy.
(Monica obeys.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Danny!

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Hey! What’s going on?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, it’s a great party! Great food. Y’know, most parties it’s all chips and salsa, chips and salsa. (As she’s saying this Rachel tries to head downstairs but is blocked by people coming upstairs. She quickly retreats back up the stairs.) (Sees that she has to keep him distracted longer.) So umm, what’s this? (Points to his plate.)
content.parenthetical: turns his back to the stairs

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Salad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooooh! (Rachel now succeeds in getting downstairs.) And-and-and what-what’s this? (Points again.)

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Bread. Aren’t you a chef?
(Rachel returns.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Hey! Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Oh right, tonight was your party.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Oh wow, you look great! Glad you could make it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh well, y’know, the gala had to end sometime.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Don’t go anywhere, I’ll be right back. (He heads off.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, sure. (To Monica) All right, whose court is the ball in now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I thought there wasn’t a ball?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on! He’s glad that I came, he doesn’t want me to go anywhere, balls flying all over the place!

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Rachel, this is my friend Tom. (To Tom) This is the girl I told you about.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, go on! You telling people about me?

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: You two could really hit it off! I’m gonna go mingle. (Leaves.)

content.speaker: Tom
content.text: So you work at Bloomingdale’s , huh? My mom calls it Bloomies.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, okay, at ease solider!

content.speaker: Tom
content.text: I’m sorry?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, it’s all right, you can just drop the act Tommy. I know what’s going on here. Your Danny’s wingman right? You guys are best buds. Frat bros!

content.speaker: Tom
content.text: I’m gonna go talk to uh, a friend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, yeah, you go talk to your friend. You tell him, “Nice try.”
(He walks off.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Man! He just keeps lobbing them up and I just keep knocking them right out of the park!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think I need a drink.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!
(They go get a drink.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross still has boxes all over the place. Joey is wearing a football helmet, and Chandler is spinning him around in one of the chairs and counting.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, I’m telling ya! I’m fine! (He tries to take a step and falls flat on his face.)
(He tries to get up again and starts falling backwards and Chandler catches him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here we go! Here we go!
(Ross enters.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey. So I uh, I didn’t get that apartment. Some problem with my application.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re kidding!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re kidding, no!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. But, the good news is that Phoebe said that I could stay at her place for a while. So…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But you can’t stay with Phoebe, Ross! We’re-we’re roomies!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, you guys don’t need me here taking up your space.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, we got plenty of space! There-there’s still some over there (Points to where the window is but sees that there isn’t any space there and points towards his door.) by-by that speaker. Please, just stay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you guys sure about this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Definitely!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! Ross, you have to stay!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, buddy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So I’m a pimp huh? It’s okay! Look, I know that sometimes I can be a pain in the ass, but you just have to talk to me. Tell me if something is bothering you. Okay? And for my part I will do everything I can to keep my annoying habits just (Does the ‘quiet down’ maneuver).
(Chandler and Joey smile, but when Ross turns away look at each other with looks of horror.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s and Ross’s, Chandler is entering and when he closes the door Joey pops his head out of the fort like before, but this time he’s wearing a cowboy hat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I see you’ve had a very productive day. Don’t you think the cowboy hat is a little much?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, it’s fun!
content.parenthetical: popping up behind Joey wearing an Indian headdress

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! (He joins them in the fort and comes up putting on a bonnet.) Isn’t this a woman’s hat?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, stop talking crazy and make us some tea!
(Chandler does so.)
